data.title: Boro, l'île d'amour : the films of Walerian Borowczyk
data.meta_description: There has been a revival of interest in the work of Polish film director Walerian Borowczyk, a label-defying auteur and "escape artist" if there ever was one. This volume, markedly experimenta
data.text:
Introduction: a private universe / Kamila Kuc, Kuba Mikurda, and Michał Oleszczyk

Boro: escape artist / Kuba Mikurda

Borowczyk's Kunstkamera / Marcin Giżycki

Animated bodies: a conversation between Kuba Mikurda and Jakub Woynarowski

Cruel imagination: Borowczyk's post-traumatic surrealism / Iwona Kurz

The postcard never sent: Guy de Maupassant and Rosalie Prudent's cinematic confession / Kamila Kuc

Boro: the guide for the perplexed / Fernando F. Croce

Borowczyk's serial labyrinth: from Goto, Isle of love (1968) to Behind convent walls (1977) / James Snazell

Immoral toys: on Borowczyk's A private collection (1973) / Edwin Carels

The beast with two backs: on Borowczyk's The beast (1975) / Phillip Warnell

Laugh in the doll house: on Victorian surrealism in the films of Walerian Borowczyk / Kamila Wielebska

Enjoying excess: a Bataillean interpretation of Story of sin (1975) by Walerian Borowczyk and Stefan Żeromski / Marta Rabikowska

The beach, the bubble and the boudoir: the meeting spaces of Walerian Borowczyk and André Pieyre de Mandiargues / Jonathan Owen

Sex and the sacred: the obstacles to desire becoming its objects / Jakub Majmurek

Reflecting on The strange case of Dr. Jekyll and Miss Osbourne (1981) / Budd Wilkins

The perils of Emmanuelle: a conversation between Odie Henderson, Simon Abrams, and Michał Oleszczyk

Revisiting Love rites (1988) / Kevin Lee
